alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Upshur; Wood (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 5:56PM CST until January 02 at 1:30PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Cherokee, Smith, Upshur and Wood. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 556 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tyler, Gilmer, Lindale, Big Sandy, Hawkins, Hoard, Hainesville, Rosewood, Noonday, Winona, Red Springs, Pritchett, Grice, Perryville and Teaselville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
